It means that AdGuard does not route your traffic through a remote server. Filtering is done right on your device.

This data covers the use and performance of the app and its configuration settings. It helps us understand the app\'s usage, popular features, and potential usability issues.

Uses HTTP/3 to speed up DNS query resolution for DNS-over-HTTPS upstreams
Sends a SERVFAIL response to the client if all upstreams, including fallback ones, fail to reply. If this setting is disabled, no response is sent to the client

AdGuard installs its certificates to filter HTTPS traffic. This allows AdGuard to block ads and trackers in most browsers
AdGuard installs its certificates to filter HTTPS traffic. This allows AdGuard to block ads in browsers and apps
Firefox has its own certificate store
Move certificate to the system store
Required to filter HTTPS traffic in apps
Older Firefox versions allow you to install the certificate directly into the browser. Newer versions require alternative installation methods

1. Open Settings → Biometrics and security → Other security settings.

2. Tap User certificates and delete the AdGuard certificate.

These instructions may differ for older or customized versions of Android. If you have trouble locating the certificates, use the search bar or contact the developers of your OS version.
To install a certificate directly, set Firefox as your default browser
Couldn\'t find Firefox on your device
Failed to open device security settings
To filter HTTPS traffic, you’ll have to reinstall the certificate

1. Open Magisk → Modules and disable AdGuard Certificate or MoveCerts!.

2. Reboot the device.

3. Open Settings → Biometrics and security → Other security settings.

4.Tap User certificates and delete the AdGuard certificate.

These instructions may differ for older or customized versions of Android. If you have trouble locating the certificates, use the search bar or contact the developers of your OS version.
Try deleting it manually via Magisk
AdGuard won’t be able to filter HTTPS traffic in apps
Move certificate to the system store?
We recommend using the adguardcert Magisk module
AdGuard will be able to filter HTTPS traffic both in browsers and apps
Certificate moved to the system store
Try moving it manually via Magisk
HTTPS traffic won’t be filtered in apps

1. Download the latest release of the adguardcert Magisk module.

2. Open Magisk → Settings and enable Zygisk.

3. Return to Modules → Install from storage and select the downloaded adguardcert file. This will move the certificate from the user to the system store.

4. Reboot the device.

Notifications about the status of AdGuard protection

Notifications about apps that may conflict with AdGuard
Protects your online activity and personal data from web trackers

Removes tracking parameters from page URLs. Blocks third-party cookies
You may have to re-log in to some websites or face other cookie-related issues

Blocks all cookies and browser APIs
Some websites may get broken or work incorrectly
Allows to set your own tracking protection parameters
Blocks trackers and web analytics using AdGuard Tracking Protection filter
Removes tracking parameters from page URLs using AdGuard URL Tracking filter
Hides queries for websites visited from a search engine
Ask websites not to track you
Sends the Global Privacy Control and Do Not Track requests to the websites you visit
Limits the time to live of third-party cookies.
Limits the time to live of first-party cookies.
Removes the ETag and If-None-Match headers from requests and responses to prevent tracking by them
Disables cached authorization data that can be used for tracking purposes. May interfere with the functionality of some browser extensions and websites
Blocks WebRTC, a known vulnerability that can leak your real IP address even if you use a proxy or VPN
Prevents browsers from receiving notifications from servers
Prevents websites from detecting your location
Prevents third parties from knowing what websites you visit
Removes identifying information from the User-Agent header
Tries to trick websites into believing that you have a different IP address
Blocks Google Chrome from sending its version and modifications information to Google domains
Modifies your outgoing traffic so that your ISP\'s Deep Packet Inspection (DPI) systems can\'t detect the websites you visit. Can\'t guarantee complete protection against all DPI systems

Ad blocking in apps, Tracking protection, Browsing Security, and Custom filters are not available in the free version
Blocks requests to malicious and phishing websites
Buy full version to unlock this feature
Protect yourself from phishing and malware

Every time you visit a website, AdGuard consults the constantly updated database of malicious and phishing domains. If the website is dangerous, you’ll see a warning message.

As AdGuard checks hash prefixes, not website URLs, it doesn\'t know what websites you visit.

Learn more
AdGuard protects you from ads and trackers. Install AdGuard VPN to make you anonymous and your traffic inconspicuous and enjoy an extra level of security

AdGuard and AdGuard VPN won\'t be able to work simultaneously. Ads and trackers won\'t be blocked when AdGuard VPN is on\n\nDisabling integration here will also disable Integrated mode in your AdGuard VPN app
AdGuard VPN and Ad Blocker apps are compatible and work together to protect you
Upgrade AdGuard to use it with AdGuard VPN
AdGuard and AdGuard VPN can work together. To make them compatible, upgrade AdGuard
Upgrade AdGuard VPN to use it with AdGuard
AdGuard and AdGuard VPN can work together. To make them compatible, upgrade AdGuard VPN

Adds and removes spaces from HTTP requests to prevent DPI systems from recognizing them
Can break access to some unencrypted websites
This setting isn\'t applied because Tracking protection is disabled

Most websites and apps use HTTPS. It encrypts connections between web browsers and apps on your device and web servers. Ads and trackers get mixed into the HTTPS traffic unless you let AdGuard filter it.
Over the years, AdGuard has earned an impeccable reputation in privacy protection. It is trusted by millions of users and praised by the media.

AdGuard filters HTTPS traffic locally on your device. Ads and trackers get cut off before they load into your browser or app.\n\nAll connections to web servers remain encrypted at all times. AdGuard authenticates web servers and verifies connection security.
To filter HTTPS traffic, AdGuard needs to install its certificate on your device. The certificate is generated and stored locally.\n\nSave the certificate to install it in the next step.
Failed to save certificate. Please try again or contact support

1. Open Settings and go to Security
2. Scroll down to Encryption & Credentials
3. Go to Install from storage
4. Select CA Certificate
5. Accept a security warning
6. Browse to the AdGuard Certificate file on your device and open it
7. Confirm the certificate installation
Failed to open Settings. Try accessing them manually

Allows to speed up DNS resolving by sending requests to all specified servers at once
